intro: Syngonanthus pallens, commonly known as the pale sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and umbellate inflorescences. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically pinnately divided, and the plant thrives in sandy or well-drained soils. Syngonanthus pallens is often found in open woodlands and along the edges of pine flatwoods.
